intro: Lastrea uraiensis, commonly known as the Uraien sandmat, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, commonly referred to as the ice plant family, and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves that store water. The plant produces small, star-shaped flowers that are typically pale yellow or white, blooming during the cooler months. Its adaptations to harsh environments include a shallow root system and the ability to photosynthesize during the day while minimizing water loss. Lastrea uraiensis is often found in sandy soils and is an important component of the local flora in its native habitat.
